answers.answer: Very good. I was re-reading that blood sugar/diabetes thread over the weekend.  You remarked that your problem (I forget the words you uesed) was resolved.  Just in case, you should consider having it checked.  Over the course of tx your red blood cells get killed off at a young age, before they accumulate more glucose.  That's what happened to me, in the absence of riba the cells lived longer, gathered more glucose and the result was the return of a blood sugar issues.  Tx does screwy things and a person needs to re-basline after the junk is out of you and you've normalized.
That's great, but what dr did the test...not your tx dr, and not your PCP?Why was he so surprised? Maybe he was just so happy he didn't know how to act!Hugs,Bug

He'd have been more surprised had you'd answered and said "YEAH, I already know, got it in the mail!",lol.And congrats again!My glucose has dropped a lot at times too, and think Fl Guy is absolulely correct in it takes time for our bodies to start back to 'normal' work! After tx 'physical therapy' to get back to normal!LL

Thanks for the advise.. I will start a daily check again, just to be sure.I am hoping its gone for good too..Ladybug ~ my treatment doctor had disappeared by the time I called to make my follow up appt.. so I saw the SR GI at the center.   I had to fill him in on my genotype and all the details of the past 48 wks of treatment.  Due to the amount of weight loss and my genotype, he was not very optimistic about it coming back UND.  thought for sure it would stll be there, and was giving me options of what to do if so.So the surprise was that he was wrong...     That was the only time he ever saw me.And I did clear so far anyway.So will keep close eye on the sugar and go from there.LL  yah right that would have been funny... Especially since he had no idea that I had a copy already..
I'm thrilled for you that it's UND at 3 month post TX!  11 more for me.
Way to go. It is great to hear the good news!
congratulations on UND at 3 month post TX. That is Fantastic New.Way to GoLynn
Terrififc!! So happy for you!!Wish you the best for a SVR life!Congrats!Charm27
Once again, I'm happy for you.  I'm looking forward to meeting you!   Susan

question: Well Saturday evening around 630 the doctor called, but it said Private and I did not pick it up.   His voice sounded so surprised.  As he told me the test was great news, UND, and how wonderful it was, that the treatment was a success, and again says undectected.  And that I was good to go.. done with treatment, and that they would want to retest in a year.   Not sure if he thought I was at 6 mos post or not, as he was not my treatment doctor.   But he will forward to my PCP and I will get them to do another test in another 3 months.If you could have just heard the surprise of what he was reading..
title: Finally the doctor called with results
